bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, April 21, 1879

div1.p: Emilie Lawrence Reed and her young son, Walter Lawrence Reed, begin a trip east from Arizona.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, April 21, 1879
div1.opener:
Best love to
Mrs. Vaughan.
W.
UNITED STATES HOTEL.
MESSRS. WILSON, PROP'RS.
2 P.M.
Trinidad, Col.,April 21st, 1879,
My darling wife:
div1.p:
By this time, you
have taken your “sleeper” at La
Junta, I suppose, & I hope that your
and son (“bad daddie”) are very comfor-
-table. As soon as I came back
from the cars, I telegraphed your de-
-parture to John Vaughan- About
12 o'clock, I got very sad, thinking of
you, my precious wife, and my darling
little boy (“Didn't, didn't day-”)- Oh! I would
have given anything in this world
to have been with you, instead of
being every hour farther separated
from you. But then I know it's
all for the best- You will have
a load of trouble removed from
your shoulders when you get east,
& be able to enjoy yourself with
friends & homefolks, instead of hav-
-ing to “slave” it a la Arizona-
And then “old Retreat” (“dar, Dar, dar”)
will have a good nurse & be able
to take the air- I have had dinner,
and ate pretty heartily, all things
considered- Soup, roast pork, chicken
giblets etc, soon filled the “void”-
I shall take an early dinner,
and after praying that the good Lord
will watch over my sweet wife
& boy, I will early retire and try to
get a good night's rest -- will go
back to Otero to-morrow morning
& will write you again, to-morrow,
from that place -- & every day until
I start from Otero- God, bless & keep
you safe from all danger, my own
little darling- Take good care of
my pretty boy- Don't let him forget
papa- Give him a hundred kisses
for me, & then let him give you as
many, for your affectionate and
devoted husband,
